maxaimodel.spark.classification package

Submodules

maxaimodel.spark.classification.spark_dt module

class maxaimodel.spark.classification.spark_dt.SparkDecisionTreeClassifier(target_col, feature_col, params=None, param_grid=None)[source]

Bases: SparkClassifierBaseModel

runs Decision Tree classifier on data and gives predictions

Parameters

  • target_col (str) – column to be predicted

  • feature_col (str) – vector of all the features to be used for prediction

  • params (dict, optional) – dictionary of parameters described [here](https://spark.apache.org/docs/latest/api/python/reference/api/pyspark.ml.classification.DecisionTreeClassifier.html). Defaults to None.

  • param_grid (dict, optional) – dictionary of parameters of type {“param”: []}. If param_grid is mentioned, it will over-write params. Defaults to None.

from maxaimodel.spark.classification import spark_dt

dt = spark_dt.SparkDecisionTreeClassifier(

target_col = ‘Survived’, feature_col = ‘features’, param_grid = {

“impurity”: [‘gini’,’entropy’], “maxDepth”: [3,5]

}

)

dt.fit(train) pred = dt.predict(test) pred.show(4) >>> +——————–+——–+————-+——————–+———-+

features|Survived|rawPrediction| probability|prediction|

[3.0,1.0,39.0,0.0… [3.0,1.0,26.0,0.0… [3.0,0.0,21.0,1.0… [3.0,1.0,28.0,1.0…

1 0 0 0

[197.0,31.0] [197.0,31.0]

[24.0,21.0]

[197.0,31.0]

[0.86403508771929… [0.86403508771929… [0.53333333333333… [0.86403508771929…

0.0 0.0 0.0 0.0

```

build(params)[source]
static load(path)[source]

method to load the saved SparkDecisionTreeClassifier model

Parameters

path (str) – path of the saved model

SparkClassifierBaseModel

maxaimodel.spark.classification.spark_fmc module

class maxaimodel.spark.classification.spark_fmc.SparkFMClassifier(target_col, feature_col, params=None, param_grid=None)[source]

Bases: SparkClassifierBaseModel

Factorization Machines learning algorithm for classification

Parameters

  • target_col (str) – column to be predicted

  • feature_col (str) – vector of all the features to be used for prediction

  • params (dict, optional) – dictionary of parameters described [here](https://spark.apache.org/docs/latest/api/python/reference/api/pyspark.ml.classification.FMClassifier.html). Defaults to None.

  • param_grid (dict, optional) – dictionary of parameters of type {“param”: []}. If param_grid is mentioned, it will over-write params. Defaults to None.

from maxaimodel.spark.classification import spark_fmc

fmc = spark_fmc.SparkFMClassifier(

target_col = ‘Survived’, feature_col = ‘features’, )

fmc.fit(train) pred = fmc.predict(test) pred.show(4) >>> +——————–+——–+——————–+——————–+———-+

features|Survived| rawPrediction| probability|prediction|

[3.0,1.0,39.0,0.0… [3.0,1.0,26.0,0.0… [3.0,0.0,21.0,1.0… [3.0,1.0,28.0,1.0…

1 0 0 0

[1.33457026278096… [0.94935179013616… [0.85640816425286… [0.85772827992116…

[0.93518095165010… [0.86974472614122… [0.84720121826394… [0.84754268646046…

0.0 0.0 0.0 0.0

fmc.save(path=”./models/gbt”) ```

maxaimodel.spark.classification.spark_gbt module

class maxaimodel.spark.classification.spark_gbt.SparkGBTClassifier(target_col, feature_col, id_col=None, params=None, param_grid=None)[source]

Bases: SparkClassifierBaseModel

runs gradient boosted classifier on data and gives predictions

Parameters

  • target_col (str) – column to be predicted

  • feature_col (str) – vectorised list of all the features used for prediction

  • params (dict, optional) – dictionary of parameters described [here](https://spark.apache.org/docs/latest/api/python/reference/api/pyspark.ml.classification.GBTClassifier.html)

  • param_grid (dict, optional) – grid of parameter containing diffferent values, kind of parameter tuning

from maxaimodel.spark.classification import spark_gbt

gbt = spark_gbt.SparkGBTClassifier(

target_col = ‘Survived’, feature_col = ‘features’, )

gbt.fit(train) pred = gbt.predict(test) pred.show(4) >>> +——————–+——–+——————–+——————–+———-+

features|Survived| rawPrediction| probability|prediction|

[3.0,1.0,39.0,0.0… [3.0,1.0,26.0,0.0… [3.0,0.0,21.0,1.0… [3.0,1.0,28.0,1.0…

1 0 0 0

[1.33457026278096… [0.94935179013616… [0.85640816425286… [0.85772827992116…

[0.93518095165010… [0.86974472614122… [0.84720121826394… [0.84754268646046…

0.0 0.0 0.0 0.0

class maxaimodel.spark.classification.spark_lr.SparkLogisticRegression(target_col, feature_col, params=None, param_grid=None, family='auto')[source]

Bases: SparkClassifierBaseModel

runs logistic regression on data and gives predictions

Parameters

  • target_col (str) – column to be predicted

  • feature_col (str) – vector of all the features to be used for prediction

  • params (dict, optional) – dictionary of parameters described [here](https://spark.apache.org/docs/latest/api/python/reference/api/pyspark.ml.classification.LogisticRegression.html). Defaults to None.

  • param_grid (dict, optional) – dictionary of parameters of type {“param”: []}. If param_grid is mentioned, it will over-write params. Defaults to None.

from maxaimodel.spark.classification import spark_lr

lr = spark_lr.SparkLogisticRegression(

target_col = ‘Survived’, feature_col = ‘features’, param_grid = {

“regParam”: [0.1,1,1.5,2], “maxIter”: [3,5]

}

)

lr.fit(train_rf) lr_pred = lr.predict(test_rf) lr_pred.show(5) >>> +——————–+——–+————-+——————–+———-+

maxaimodel.spark.classification.spark_mlp module

class maxaimodel.spark.classification.spark_mlp.SparkMultilayerPerceptronClassifier(target_col, feature_col, params=None, param_grid=None)[source]

Bases: SparkClassifierBaseModel

Classifier trainer based on the Multilayer Perceptron

Parameters

  • target_col (str) – column to be predicted

  • feature_col (str) – vector of all the features to be used for prediction

  • params (dict, optional) – dictionary of parameters described [here](https://spark.apache.org/docs/latest/api/python/reference/api/pyspark.ml.classification.MultilayerPerceptronClassifier.html). Defaults to None.

  • param_grid (dict, optional) – dictionary of parameters of type {“param”: []}. If param_grid is mentioned, it will over-write params. Defaults to None.

— .. rubric:: Examples

from maxaimodel.spark.classification import spark_mlp

mlp = spark_mlp.MultilayerPerceptronClassifier(

target_col = ‘Survived’, feature_col = ‘features’, param_grid = {

“regParam”: [0.1,1,1.5,2], “maxIter”: [3,5]

}

)

mlp.fit(train_mlp) mlp_pred = mlp.predict(test_mlp) mlp_pred.show(5) >>> +——————–+——–+————-+——————–+———-+

features|Survived|rawPrediction| probability|prediction|

[3.0,1.0,39.0,0.0… [3.0,1.0,26.0,0.0… [3.0,0.0,21.0,1.0… [3.0,1.0,28.0,1.0…

1 0 0 0

[197.0,31.0] [197.0,31.0]

[24.0,21.0]

[197.0,31.0]

[0.86403508771929… [0.86403508771929… [0.53333333333333… [0.86403508771929…

0.0 0.0 0.0 0.0

mlp.save(path=”./models/mlp”) ```

  • params (dict, optional) – dictionary of parameters described [here](https://spark.apache.org/docs/latest/api/python/reference/api/pyspark.ml.classification.NaiveBayes.html). Defaults to None.

  • param_grid (dict, optional) – dictionary of parameters of type {“param”: []}. If param_grid is mentioned, it will over-write params. Defaults to None.

from maxaimodel.spark.classification import spark_nb

nb = spark_nbb.SparkNaiveBayes(

target_col = ‘Survived’, feature_col = ‘features’, param_grid = {

“regParam”: [0.1,1,1.5,2], “maxIter”: [3,5]

}

maxaimodel.spark.classification.spark_ovr module

class maxaimodel.spark.classification.spark_ovr.SparkOneVsRest(target_col, feature_col, params={}, param_grid={}, classifier=None)[source]

Bases: SparkClassifierBaseModel

Reduction of Multiclass Classification to Binary Classification. Performs reduction using one against all strategy.

Parameters

  • target_col (str) – column to be predicted

  • feature_col (str) – vector of all the features to be used for prediction

  • classifier (maxaibase.model.spark.spark_classifier.SparkClassifierBaseModel) – base model on which OneVsRest is to be run

  • params (dict, optional) – dictionary of parameters described [here](https://spark.apache.org/docs/latest/api/python/reference/api/pyspark.ml.classification.OneVsRest.html). Defaults to None.

  • param_grid (dict, optional) – dictionary of parameters of type {“param”: []}. If param_grid is mentioned, it will over-write params. Defaults to None.

from maxaimodel.spark.classification import spark_ovr, spark_lr

# declare the classifier that would act as base classifier for OneVsRest lr = spark_lr.SparkLogisticRegression(target_col=”Species”, feature_col=”label”)

ovr = spark_ovr.SparkOneVsRest(

target_col = ‘label’, feature_col = ‘features’, param_grid = {}, classifier = lr )

ovr.fit(train_vecovr) prd_ovr = ovr.predict(test_vecovr) prd_ovr.show(5) >>> +—————–+——-+——————–+———-+

features|Species| rawPrediction|prediction|

[6.5,3.0,5.8,2.2] [5.5,2.3,4.0,1.3] [6.4,2.9,4.3,1.3] [4.8,3.4,1.9,0.2] [5.7,2.8,4.5,1.3]

2 1 1 0 1

[-51.235730144288… [-35.771347249773… [-29.856819249743… [30.8709864367496… [-27.387459642795…

2.0 1.0 1.0 0.0 1.0

```

best_params()[source]

used to find best parameters for model

dict of best hyperparameter

maxaimodel.spark.classification.spark_rf module

class maxaimodel.spark.classification.spark_rf.SparkRFClassifier(target_col, feature_col, id_col=None, params=None, param_grid=None)[source]

Bases: SparkClassifierBaseModel

runs random forest on data and gives predictions

Parameters

  • target_col (str) – column to be predicted

  • feature_col (str) – vector of all the features to be used for prediction

  • params (dict, optional) – dictionary of parameters described [here](https://spark.apache.org/docs/latest/api/python/reference/api/pyspark.ml.classification.RandomForestClassifier.html). Defaults to None.

  • param_grid (dict, optional) – dictionary of parameters of type {“param”: []}. If param_grid is mentioned, it will over-write params. Defaults to None.

from maxaimodel.spark.classification import spark_rf

rf = spark_rf.SparkRFClassifier(

id_col = ‘id’, target_col = ‘Survived’, feature_col = ‘features’, param_grid = {

“impurity”: [‘gini’,’entropy’], “maxDepth”: [3,5]

}

)

rf.fit(train_rf) rf_pred = rf.predict(test_rf) rf_pred.show(5) >>> +——————–+——–+————-+——————–+———-+

features|Survived|rawPrediction| probability|prediction|

[3.0,1.0,39.0,0.0… [3.0,1.0,26.0,0.0… [3.0,0.0,21.0,1.0… [3.0,1.0,28.0,1.0…

1 0 0 0

[197.0,31.0] [197.0,31.0]

[24.0,21.0]

[197.0,31.0]

[0.86403508771929… [0.86403508771929… [0.53333333333333… [0.86403508771929…

0.0 0.0 0.0 0.0

rf.save(path = “./models/rf”) ```

runs support vectors on data and gives predictions

  • feature_col (str) – vector of all the features to be used for prediction

  • params (dict, optional) – dictionary of parameters described [here](https://spark.apache.org/docs/latest/api/python/reference/api/pyspark.ml.classification.RandomForestClassifier.html). Defaults to None.

  • param_grid (dict, optional) – dictionary of parameters of type {“param”: []}. If param_grid is mentioned, it will over-write params. Defaults to None.

from maxaimodel.spark.classification import spark_svc

svc = spark_lr.SparkLinearSVC(

target_col = ‘Survived’, feature_col = ‘features’, param_grid = {

“regParam”: [0.1,1,1.5,2], “maxIter”: [3,5]

}

)
